meanings.definition: Existing in great quantity or ample supply.
meanings.sent1: The garden had plentiful flowers of all colors.
meanings.sent2: She found a plentiful supply of apples at the market.
meanings.sent3: The picnic basket was so plentiful, it seemed like a magic trick!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as plentiful as a summer rain.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the night sky were as plentiful as grains of sand on the beach.

meanings.sent1: The forest was plentiful with tall trees and chirping birds.
meanings.sent2: There were plentiful opportunities for learning in the new school.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity was so plentiful, it got stuck in a box.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was as plentiful as the sunshine on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd were as plentiful as confetti at a celebration.
